SEARCH
Package app

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
app.GameController
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiplayerController, SinglePlayerController
public abstract class GameController extends Object
Controls the game flow and contains core game logic for the Parade card game. This abstract class serves as the base for both single and multiplayer game modes. The class manages: 1. Game state and turn management 2. Player interactions and card plays 3. Score calculation and winner determination 4. Final round handling

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer(String playerName, List<Card> clientsDeck)
      Creates a new HumanPlayer to the game.
      Parameters:
      playerName - Unique username of the HumanPlayer.
      clientsDeck - Contains a subset of Deck that will be used to create the Player's initial hand.

    • createPlayer

      Creates a new ComputerPlayer to the game.

      Parameters:
      player - Player who is currently playing.
      Returns:
      Card that is played.

    • isGameEnded

      public boolean isGameEnded()
      Checks if the game has ended. The game has ended if a Player has collected at least 1 Card per color, or Deck is empty.
      Returns:
      true if any of the game-ending conditions are met, and false otherwise.

    • getWinner

      public List<Player> getWinner()
      Finds the winner.
      Returns:
      Player who won

      Calculates and returns the score for each Player.
      Returns:
      The score for each Player.

      Displays the winner of the game.
      Parameters:
      paradeWinner - List of Players who won.
      winnerNames - String containing the names of Players who won.
      output - Method used to output the ASCII art. Either server::broadcastMessage or System.out::println.

    • startGame

      public abstract void startGame() throws IOException
      Starts a game played between Players. This method contains the game loop.
      Throws:
      IOException - Occurs when there is error in handling a turn when playing against other HumanPlayers. This Exception is thrown when there is an invalid input.

    • handlePlayerTurn

      public abstract List<Card> handlePlayerTurn(Player player) throws IOException
      Handles a Player's turn. This method is used for a multiplayer game.
      Parameters:
      player - Current HumanPlayer playing.
      Returns:
      A list of Cards that is collected at the end of the turn.
      Throws:
      IOException - This Exception is thrown when a HumanPlayer disconnects from the Server.

    • chooseCardsToDiscard

      public abstract int[] chooseCardsToDiscard(HumanPlayer player)
      Asks the HumanPlayers to discard 2 Cards from their hands.
      Parameters:
      player - Target HumanPlayer.
      Returns:
      The 2 indicies of the Cards to discard.
